title: Urgent: Your Package is On Hold
description: Received a text message claiming a package from a well-known delivery service is on hold. It asks me to click a link to reschedule delivery and pay a small fee. The website looks suspicious.

title: Suspicious Account Activity - Action Required
description: An email pretending to be from my bank states that there has been suspicious activity on my account. It urges me to log in via a provided link to verify my identity. The sender's email address is slightly off.

title: Exclusive Work-From-Home Job Opportunity
description: A LinkedIn message offered a high-paying remote data entry job. The 'recruiter' asked for my personal information and a small fee for 'training materials' before any formal interview process.

title: Guaranteed High Returns on Crypto Investment
description: An ad on social media promoted a new cryptocurrency with guaranteed 50% weekly returns. The platform required a minimum investment and showed fake profit gains, but withdrawals are impossible.

title: Warning: Your Computer is Infected!
description: A loud pop-up appeared on a website, claiming my computer was infected with multiple viruses. It provided a toll-free number to call for 'Microsoft Certified' tech support. They wanted remote access to my PC.

title: Claim Your Free Government Grant
description: Got a Facebook message from someone claiming to work for a government agency. They said I was eligible for a free grant but needed to pay a 'processing fee' via gift cards to receive the funds.
